item.title: Self-Supervised Contrastive Approaches for Video Representation Learning
item.description: Advances in the contrastive learning domain have made it possible to reduce the performance gap between self-supervised and supervised learning methods. Consequently, it has enabled the potential of utilizing the vast amount of unlabeled big data. This article goes over state-of-the-art contrastive learning methods for effective video representation learning.

item.title: Building a spell-checker with FastText word embeddings
item.description: Word vector representations with subword information are great for NLP modeling. But can we make lexical corrections using a trained embeddings space? Can its accuracy be high enough to beat Peter Norvig’s spell-corrector? Let’s find out!
